recipes.name: Vegetable Curry Puff
ingredients: ½ cup potatoes, peeled and diced into small cubes
⅓ to ½ cup carrots, peeled and diced into small cubes
⅓ cup green peas, fresh or frozen (approximately 60 grams)
1.5 to 2 tablespoons neutral flavored oil, for sautéing
¼ to ½ teaspoon red chili powder or cayenne pepper, to taste
¼ to ½ teaspoon garam masala or curry powder, to taste
directions: Step 1: Rinse, peel, and chop the potatoes and carrots into small cubes.
Step 2: In a small bowl, combine the chopped potatoes, carrots, and green peas.
Step 3: Place this bowl in a 3-liter stovetop pressure cooker with 1.5 cups of water. Use a small trivet to elevate the bowl above the water.
Step 4: Pressure cook on medium heat for 3 to 4 whistles, or 8 to 9 minutes, until the vegetables are fork-tender.
Step 5: Once the pressure releases naturally, open the lid and check the vegetables for doneness.
Step 6: Drain any excess water from the vegetables and set them aside.
Step 7: In a sauté pan or kadai, heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onions.
Step 8: Sauté the onions on low to medium heat until they are light golden brown.
Step 9: Add the ginger-garlic paste and sauté for about 1 minute, or until the raw aroma dissipates.
Step 10: Incorporate the steamed vegetables into the pan and mix well.
Step 11: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix until the spices and seasonings are evenly distributed.
Step 12: Taste the mixture and adjust seasonings as desired. Lastly, add the chopped coriander leaves and mix thoroughly.
Step 13: Set the vegetable filling aside to cool at room temperature.
Step 14: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F) for at least 15 minutes.
Step 15: Follow the instructions on the puff pastry package to thaw it, and optionally roll it to ¼ to ½ inch thickness.
Step 16: Cut the puff pastry into equal squares or rectangles, trimming the edges if desired.
Step 17: Place 2 to 3 tablespoons of vegetable filling in the center of each pastry piece.
Step 18: Brush the edges of the pastry with water, then fold and press the edges to seal them, taking care not to squish the layers.
Step 19: Optionally press the edges lightly with a fork for decoration, and brush with milk for a golden color.
Step 20: Place the prepared puff pastries on the center rack of the preheated oven.
Step 21: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden and crisp, checking periodically as oven temperatures may vary.
Step 22: Once baked, carefully remove the tray from the oven and let the puffs cool for 2 to 3 minutes on a wire rack.
Step 23: Serve the vegetable curry puffs warm or at room temperature with green chutney, tomato ketchup, or mayo dip.
Step 24: If not serving immediately, store in an airtight container. They can be refrigerated for 3 to 4 days and reheated in an oven, frying pan, or skillet.

recipes.name: Pan-Seared Halibut in Vegetable Broth
ingredients: 600 ml vegetable stock (or enough to cover the vegetables)
300 grams summer vegetables, shredded (e.g., Savoy cabbage)
50 grams small pasta (such as orzo or campanelle)
2 fillets of halibut or other sustainable white fish (approximately 100 grams each)
Nutrition Information: Calories: 398, Fat: 18g, Carbs: 27g, Protein: 48g
directions: 1. Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the diced shallot and fry for 1 minute until softened.
2. Pour in the vegetable stock and bring to a boil.
3. Add the shredded summer vegetables and small pasta to the boiling stock. Reduce heat and simmer for 5-8 minutes, or until the greens are tender but the pasta remains al dente.
4. Incorporate the peas during the last minute of cooking.
5. While the soup simmers, season the halibut fillets with salt and pepper. In a separate frying pan, heat the butter over medium heat.
6. Add the seasoned halibut fillets to the pan and cook for 2 minutes on each side, or until the fish is golden and flakes easily with a fork.
7. To serve, divide the broth and vegetables among shallow soup bowls, placing a halibut fillet on top of each serving.

Incorporate a wooden table background and subtle kitchen props, ensuring a shallow depth of field that softly blurs the foreground for an elegant, magazine-worthy finish.

recipes.name: Vegetable Dum Biryani
ingredients: 1.5 cups basmati rice, aged, rinsed and soaked in 1 cup water for 30 minutes
1 cup chopped potatoes, about 2 medium-sized or 100 grams
½ cup chopped carrots, approximately 100 grams or 1 medium to large carrot
¼ cup chopped french beans, roughly 50 grams or 11 to 12 beans
¼ to ⅓ cup chopped bell pepper, about 50 grams (optional)
½ cup green peas, fresh or frozen
1 cup thinly sliced onions, heaped, approximately 115 grams or 1 large onion
1.5 tablespoons finely chopped ginger, about 10 grams or 2 pieces of 2-inch ginger
1 tablespoon finely chopped garlic, about 5 grams or 10 to 12 cloves
1 teaspoon red chili powder, cayenne pepper, or paprika
½ cup water for pressure cooking
¾ cup water for cooking in a pan
2 tablespoons almonds, raw or blanched, peeled and sliced
⅓ cup chopped coriander leaves (cilantro), approximately 20 grams
⅓ cup chopped mint leaves, about 5 grams
2 teaspoons kewra water (pandanus water) or rose water
directions: 1. Rinse the basmati rice under running water until the water runs clear, then soak in 1 cup of water for 30 minutes.
2. After soaking, drain the rice and set aside.
3. While the rice is soaking, prepare all the vegetables and other ingredients; keep them set aside.
4. In a deep-bottomed pan, bring 5 cups of water to a boil over high heat.
5. Once boiling, add salt and the following whole spices: tej patta, green cardamoms, cloves, black cardamom, cinnamon, and mace strands.
6. Carefully add the soaked basmati rice to the boiling water and stir gently with a spoon or fork.
7. Cook the rice until it is 75% cooked; it should have a slight bite, then drain in a colander and fluff it gently. Set aside.
8. In a 2-litre pressure cooker or heavy pan, heat the ghee (or oil) over medium heat.
9. Add shah jeera, tej patta, green cardamoms, cloves, black cardamom, and cinnamon to the hot ghee, sautéing until fragrant.
10. Incorporate the sliced onions, stirring until they become golden brown.
11. Add a pinch of salt to the onions to speed the cooking process.
12. While the onions cook, whisk the 1 cup of curd in a bowl until smooth.
13. Once the onions are caramelized, mix in the ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cooking until the raw aroma disappears.
14. Stir in turmeric and red chili powder, mixing well.
15. Add the prepared chopped vegetables and sauté for 2 minutes.
16. Reduce the heat and pour in the whisked curd, stirring immediately, followed by ½ cup water for pressure cooking (¾ cup if using a pan).
17. Season with salt and stir until everything is well combined.
18. Pressure cook for 1 whistle on medium heat for 3-4 minutes, or in a pan until vegetables are tender without overcooking.
19. Warm 4 to 5 tablespoons of milk and stir in ¼ teaspoon saffron strands; set aside.
20. After the pressure has settled, check the gravy for vegetable doneness, simmering further if needed.
21. If the mixture is too watery, continue simmering until a medium-thick consistency is achieved.
22. Stir in cashews, raisins, and almonds into the vegetable gravy, adjusting salt to taste.
23. Layer half the vegetable gravy in a thick-bottomed pan, followed by half the semi-cooked rice.
24. Add half of the chopped coriander and mint leaves, along with half of the saffron milk.
25. Layer the remaining vegetable gravy on top, followed by the remaining rice, coriander, mint, and saffron milk. Drizzle with kewra or rose water.
26. Seal the pan tightly with aluminum foil and a lid; alternatively, use a moist cotton cloth to seal it.
27. Heat a tava or skillet over medium heat; once hot, reduce to low flame and place the sealed biryani on top.
28. Cook on low flame for 30-35 minutes, ensuring moisture content is well-managed.
29. After cooking, check the bottom layer to confirm no liquid remains; adjust timing as necessary.
30. Allow the biryani to rest for 5-7 minutes before serving, ensuring even distribution of rice and vegetables.

recipes.name: Veg Manchurian Rice
ingredients: 1 cup diced red and green capsicum
3 teaspoons cornflour mixed with enough water to make a thin paste
directions: Step 1: Assemble all the ingredients.
Step 2: In a bowl, combine shredded cabbage and carrots.
Step 3: Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl one by one and mix well.
Step 4: Grease your hands and form small golf-sized balls from the mixture, making about 8-9 Manchurian balls.
Step 5: Grease an appe pan and place the Manchurian balls in each cavity.
Step 6: Flip the balls and cook evenly on all sides until golden brown.
Step 7: Alternatively, you can deep fry the Manchurian balls until cooked through and golden.
Step 8: Once the Manchurian balls are ready, set them aside.
Step 9: In a large pan, heat olive oil and add the ginger and garlic paste, sauté for 1-2 minutes.
Step 10: Add the shredded carrots and cubed capsicum, then sauté for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Step 11: Next, add the cubed onions and sauté until translucent.
Step 12: Stir in the chili garlic sauce and cook for another minute.
Step 13: Add the remaining sauces, the cornflour mixture, and the spices, mixing well.
Step 14: Gently toss the prepared Manchurian balls into the mixture.
Step 15: Add the boiled rice and mix until everything is well combined.
Step 16: Adjust seasoning as necessary, then top with chopped spring onions.
Step 17: Serve the Veg Manchurian Rice hot and enjoy!

recipes.name: Veggie Delight Soup
ingredients: 3 ribs celery, chopped (leaves can be included)
2 medium white potatoes, peeled and diced (about 1/2 lb)
3 cups chicken broth (vegetable broth can be used as a substitute)
1/2 cup small pasta (such as ditalini, small shells, orzo, or alphabet pasta, optional)
directions: Step 1: Cut all vegetables except for the tomatoes into bite-sized pieces. If preferred, cut the tomatoes into smaller pieces directly in the can with a sharp knife.
Step 2: Add the prepared vegetables and tomatoes along with their juices to a large soup pot or Dutch oven.
Step 3: Stir in the brown sugar to neutralize the acidity of the tomatoes, making them taste more like homegrown.
Step 4: Add the chicken broth, bay leaf, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper. (Adjust the seasoning according to your taste preferences; start with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.)
Step 5: Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat.
Step 6: Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and let the soup simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
Step 7: Check the vegetables for doneness; they should be tender yet firm to the bite. If not ready, continue cooking for an additional 5-10 minutes.
Step 8: If adding pasta, stir it into the pot and cook for an additional 10 minutes or until the pasta is al dente.
Step 9: Remove and discard the bay leaf before serving. Enjoy your delicious Veggie Delight Soup!

recipes.name: Vegetable Paratha
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour, for dough
1 teaspoon red chili powder, for heat
1/4 teaspoon garam masala powder, optional for seasoning
1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, cabbage), finely chopped and cooked
directions: Step 1: Finely chop the vegetables using a food processor or chopper. Pressure cook them with salt, turmeric powder, and a little water for 2 whistles on medium flame. Mash the cooked vegetables well and reserve the vegetable stock.

Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the mashed vegetables with whole wheat flour, red chili powder, cumin powder, garam masala (if using), chopped capsicum, chopped coriander leaves, and salt. Gradually add the reserved vegetable stock and additional water as needed to form a soft and pliable dough.
Step 3: Allow the dough to rest for at least 30 minutes. After resting, divide the dough into lemon-sized balls.
Step 4: Dust a clean rolling surface with flour and roll each ball into thin or thick parathas as desired.
Step 5: Heat oil on a tawa (griddle) and cook the parathas on both sides until they are golden brown and cooked through.

Garnish with a sprig of fresh coriander and a side of tangy yogurt in a small bowl. Use a shallow depth of field to blur the background slightly, keeping the focus on the paratha’s texture, while creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Vegetable Raita
ingredients: 1 cup yogurt (dairy or vegan) – whisked until smooth
1 small to medium carrot – peeled and finely chopped
1 small to medium bell pepper (red, orange, yellow, or green) – finely chopped
1 medium cucumber – peeled and finely chopped
1 small to medium onion – finely chopped (optional)
Black salt or rock salt – to taste
directions: Step 1: Whisk the yogurt until it's smooth and creamy.
Step 2: Add the black pepper powder, roasted cumin powder, and black salt to the yogurt, then mix well.
Step 3: Stir in the chopped carrot, bell pepper, cucumber, tomato, and onion into the yogurt mixture until well combined.
Step 4: Taste the raita and adjust the seasoning with more spice powders or salt if necessary.
Step 5: Serve the vegetable raita immediately, or chill in the refrigerator before serving.

recipes.name: Vegetable Jambalaya
ingredients: 1 can (16 ounces) butter beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (16 ounces) red beans, rinsed and drained
directions: 1. In a Dutch oven, heat the canola oil over medium-high heat.
2. Add the chopped green pepper, onion, and celery; cook and stir until the vegetables are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Stir in the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute until fragrant.
4. Add the water, undrained diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and seasonings; bring the mixture to a boil.
5. Stir in the uncooked long grain rice and reduce the heat.
6. Cover and simmer for 15-18 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender.
7. Gently stir in the rinsed butter beans and red beans; heat through before serving.

recipes.name: Braised Spring Vegetables
ingredients: 1 small bunch flat-leaf parsley, leaves chopped and stalks finely chopped
200g baby leeks, cut in half lengthways
400g baby zucchini, cut into 1 cm thick rounds
2 bunches asparagus, stalks trimmed, sliced with tips intact
Juice of 1 lemon and finely grated zest
directions: Step 1: Toast the breadcrumbs in a dry frying pan over medium heat until golden brown. Set aside in a bowl.
Step 2: Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large frying pan with a lid over medium heat.
Step 3: Add the chopped garlic, parsley stalks, and sliced leeks to the pan. Cook for 10 minutes, or until the leeks become soft and translucent.
Step 4: Incorporate the zucchini into the pan, followed by the white wine. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Step 5: Reduce the heat, cover the pan with the lid, and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Step 6: Add the asparagus, peas, and broad beans to the pan. Season well with salt and pepper, then cook on low heat for 7–8 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
Step 7: Combine the lemon zest with the toasted breadcrumbs and the chopped parsley leaves.
Step 8: Squeeze the lemon juice over the cooked vegetables before serving. Top with the breadcrumb mixture and a dollop of thick Greek-style yoghurt.

recipes.name: Spring Vegetable Pasta with Asparagus and Courgettes
ingredients: 350 grams asparagus, trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces
1 handful freshly grated Parmesan cheese, plus extra for serving
1/2 bunch fresh mint leaves, roughly chopped
directions: 1. Fill a large saucepan with water, add a generous pinch of sea salt, and bring it to a boil.
2. Using a speed peeler, peel the courgettes into ribbons and set them aside.
3. In a large mixing bowl, break the eggs and add the crème fraîche and grated Parmesan cheese. Finely grate in the lemon zest, then season with salt and black pepper. Mix well to combine.
4. Cook the tagliatelle in the boiling water according to the package instructions until al dente.
5. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the diced pancetta and cook for 4 to 5 minutes, or until golden and crisp.
6. Reserve a cupful of the pasta cooking water, then drain the tagliatelle.

7. Off the heat, add the drained pasta to the skillet with the pancetta. Fold in most of the chopped mint, the courgette ribbons, and the egg mixture. Add a splash of the reserved pasta water and stir everything together until combined, adding more water if necessary to create a creamy consistency.
8. Serve the pasta in bowls, garnishing with the remaining mint leaves and additional grated Parmesan cheese.

recipes.name: Cajun Roast Chicken with Vegetables and Spicy Gravy
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 200°C (gas mark 6). Place the chicken on a clean cutting board.
2. In a pestle and mortar, combine the dried oregano, smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, allspice berries, sea salt, and black pepper. Bash well to mix.
3. Add the orange zest and half of the thyme leaves to the spice mixture, and bash again. Stir in 1 tablespoon of olive oil, then rub this mixture all over the chicken.
4. Peel and roughly chop the onion and 1 carrot, then place them in a roasting tin.
5. Position the chicken on top of the vegetables and drizzle olive oil over the skin. Insert one half of the zested orange into the cavity of the chicken and set the other half aside.
6. Reduce the oven temperature to 180°C (gas mark 4) and roast the chicken for approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until golden and juices run clear when pierced at the thickest part.
7. Meanwhile, parboil the halved potatoes for 5 to 6 minutes, then drain and let them steam dry for a few minutes.

8. Shake the potatoes to scuff their edges, then transfer them to a roasting tin and season with salt. Mix in the unpeeled garlic cloves and a drizzle of olive oil. Roast alongside the chicken for about 50 minutes.
9. Halve the remaining carrots lengthwise and parboil for 4 minutes. Drain and allow them to steam dry.
10. Combine the parboiled carrots in a roasting tin, season, and toss with honey, the remaining thyme leaves, and the reserved orange juice. Set aside.
11. Once the chicken is cooked, carefully remove it from the oven and transfer it to a board to rest, loosely covering it with foil.

12. Prepare the gravy by dissolving the stock cube in 750 ml of just-boiled water. Place the roasting tin over medium heat, sprinkle in the flour, and scrape up the sticky bits from the bottom. Cook the flour until it is browned but not burnt, then gradually add the stock.
13. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer rapidly for 5 minutes while stirring. Strain the gravy through a sieve when it reaches your desired consistency.
14. Check the potatoes, shaking the tray to turn them, and return the carrots to the oven until ready to serve with the Cajun roast chicken and spicy gravy.

recipes.name: Moroccan Vegetable and Chickpea Tagine
ingredients: 1 medium red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
400 grams canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained
Fresh flat-leaf parsley, chopped, for garnish
directions: Step 1: Heat a spray of olive oil in a large tagine or saucepan over medium heat. Add the chopped red onion and garlic; sauté for 5 minutes until softened.
Step 2: Stir in the ground cumin, ground coriander, and ground cinnamon, cooking for an additional minute until the spices are fragrant.
Step 3: Add the chopped red pepper, courgette, and aubergine; cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally until the vegetables are well coated with spices and begin to color.
Step 4: Incorporate the rinsed chickpeas, vegetable stock, harissa, and sliced prunes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a simmer and cover.
Step 5: Let the mixture simmer for 15-20 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Step 6: Remove from heat, garnish with freshly chopped parsley, and serve with steamed couscous if desired.

recipes.name: Shahi Vegetable Biryani
ingredients: 2-3 tablespoons milk, to sprinkle on rice
2 tablespoons chopped cilantro leaves, for garnish
directions: Step 1: Assemble all the spices for the ‘Shahi Masala’. Dry roast the spices in a heavy-bottomed pan for 1-2 minutes and allow to cool.
Step 2: Transfer the dry roasted spices to a grinder and grind to a fine powder. Set aside.
Step 3: Prepare the gravy by washing and dicing the vegetables according to taste. Feel free to adjust the spice levels.
Step 4: In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat the ghee or oil and add the ginger-garlic paste. Sauté for a couple of minutes until fragrant.
Step 5: Add the finely chopped onion to the pan and cook until translucent.
Step 6: Stir in the diced carrots and green beans, followed by the tomato puree. Mix well.
Step 7: Add salt and 3 tablespoons of water, mixing thoroughly. Cover the pan and cook until the vegetables are soft.
Step 8: Remove the lid, pour in the cream, and mix well.
Step 9: Add 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons of the prepared Shahi masala to the pan and stir to combine.
Step 10: Incorporate the sliced red capsicum and shredded cabbage. Cook for an additional minute, then remove from heat and set aside.
Step 11: Prepare the rice by heating oil in another heavy-bottomed pot, then add the whole spices (green cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, star anise).
Step 12: Add sliced onions and sauté until lightly browned.
Step 13: Pour in the water, then add the rinsed basmati rice and salt. Stir well and bring to a boil.
Step 14: Add the chopped mint and cilantro leaves, mixing gently. Parboil the rice until most of the water evaporates.
Step 15: Fluff the rice with a fork and set aside.
Step 16: To prepare crispy onions, dust onion rings with cornstarch, shake off excess, and fry in hot oil until crunchy. Drain on a paper towel.
Step 17: Fry the mixed nuts in the same manner until golden and set aside.
Step 18: To assemble the Biryani, take a deep dish (handi) and drizzle some oil or ghee at the base.
Step 19: Add a layer of parboiled rice as the base, followed by a layer of sautéed vegetables.
Step 20: Repeat the layering process until all the rice and vegetables are used. Finish by sprinkling milk on top.
Step 21: Top the final layer with fried onions and mixed nuts.
Step 22: Garnish with chopped cilantro leaves, cover the dish, and seal with dough if desired. Cook on low flame for 10-15 minutes.
Step 23: Once cooked, remove the dough and uncover the pot. Gently fluff the rice again.
Step 24: Serve hot with your favorite raita or chutney.

recipes.name: Veg Puff Mummies
ingredients: A small splash of lime juice
A handful of chopped fresh coriander
directions: 1. Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat and add the cumin seeds; allow them to temper.
2. Add the chopped onions to the pan and sauté until they become slightly soft.
3. Incorporate the chopped bell pepper, carrots, corn, peas, and potatoes into the pan. Sauté the mixture for about one minute.
4. Stir in the red chilli powder, turmeric, cumin powder, and garam masala. Follow this by adding the chopped mint leaves.

5. Cover the pan and cook for approximately five minutes, adding a sprinkle of water if needed to soften the vegetables. Remove the mixture from heat and allow it to cool completely. Then, fold in the chopped coriander and set aside.
6. Thaw the puff pastry sheet according to package instructions, then roll it out to smooth the creases, ensuring it measures around 9.5" x 11".
7. Use two corn kernels to create the 'eyes' of the mummies and brush the pastry with milk.
8. Cut the pastry sheet into four squares and lightly crease each piece into thirds.
9. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C) and prepare a small baking tray by lining it with foil.

10. Cut the outer thirds of each square into thin strips. Place a portion of the filling in the center of each square. Fold the strips over the filling, alternating left and right, and stretch them to tuck under the filling, ensuring to leave space for the eyes.
11. Bake the pastries in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes until the tops are golden brown.
12. Transfer the baked pastries to a wire rack to cool slightly, then serve warm.
13. To reheat, place any leftover pastries in a 200°F (90°C) oven for 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Vegetable Peel Fritters
ingredients: 150 g mixed vegetable peelings (potato, carrot, parsnip), finely chopped
Lime pickle, mango chutney, and raita for serving
directions: 1. Heat 500 ml of vegetable oil in a deep saucepan over medium-low heat, ensuring the oil is not more than two-thirds full.

2. In a mixing bowl, combine 100 ml of water with 1 beaten egg. Add 100 g of sifted gram flour, ½ teaspoon baking powder, ½ teaspoon chili powder, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon nigella seeds, ½ teaspoon turmeric powder, and 1 teaspoon fine sea salt. Mix until a thick paste forms.
3. Stir in 150 g of finely chopped mixed vegetable peelings and ½ sliced onion until well combined. If the mixture is too thick, add another splash of water to loosen.

4. To test if the oil is hot enough, drop in a small amount of batter. If it rises to the surface surrounded by bubbles and starts to brown, the oil is ready for frying. If not, increase the heat to medium-high.
5. Carefully drop heaped tablespoons of the mixture into the hot oil, working in batches. Flatten each fritter gently with the back of a spoon.
6. Fry for 3-4 minutes, turning once, until the fritters are evenly browned and crisp.
7. Remove the fritters from the oil and drain them on kitchen paper. Sprinkle with a little salt while they are still hot.
8. Serve the fritters warm with lime pickle, mango chutney, and raita.

recipes.name: Vegan Savory Waffles
ingredients: 230 grams type 2 flour (or whole wheat flour)
directions: Step 1: Grind the flaxseeds into a fine powder for about 10 seconds at speed 10.
Step 2: Add the remaining ingredients into the mixing bowl and blend for 30 seconds at speed 4 until smooth.
Step 3: Preheat a waffle maker and lightly grease it with oil. Pour approximately 2 tablespoons of batter into the waffle maker for each waffle.
Step 4: Cook the waffles for about 10 minutes, or until the batter easily releases from the plates and is golden brown.
Step 5: Serve warm, and fill with your choice of toppings.

recipes.name: Chicken Soup with Spring Vegetables and Orzo Pasta
ingredients: 1 small bunch fresh flat-leaf parsley, chopped
1 large onion, peeled and quartered (for stock)
2 carrots, scrubbed and roughly chopped (for stock)
A handful of fresh flat-leaf parsley (optional garnish)
directions: Step 1: To prepare the stock, combine the chicken carcass, quartered onion, chopped carrots, celery, black peppercorns, and a small bunch of parsley in a large saucepan.
Step 2: Cover the ingredients with 3 liters of cold water and season lightly with salt.
Step 3: Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, skimming off any froth that rises to the surface.
Step 4: Once boiling, reduce the heat, cover with a lid, and let it simmer slowly for 3 hours.
Step 5: After simmering, strain the broth through a sieve to remove solids and allow it to cool.
Step 6: In another large saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
Step 7: Add the chopped onion, leek, celery, carrots, and courgettes, and sauté for 5 minutes until softened.
Step 8: Stir in the orzo pasta and pour in the prepared chicken stock.
Step 9: Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 8 to 10 minutes until the vegetables are cooked and the orzo is tender.
Step 10: Stir in the frozen peas and shredded chicken until heated through. Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper.
Step 11: Divide the soup among bowls, garnish with fresh parsley, and serve hot.

recipes.name: Light and Savory Vegetable Chili
ingredients: 1.5 cups chopped green bell peppers (about 1 medium pepper)
1.5 cups chopped red bell peppers (about 1 medium pepper)
1 cup beer (any variety, even non-alcoholic options like O'Douls)
1 tablespoon chipotle chile in adobo sauce (or substitute with 2 tablespoons green chiles)
1 (15-ounce) can red beans, rinsed and drained
1 (15-ounce) can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), rinsed and drained
1 (15-ounce) can cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Step 1: Heat the canola oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Step 2: Add the chopped onions and bell peppers to the pot; sauté for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
Step 3: Stir in the chili powder and minced garlic; cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Step 4: Pour in the vegetable broth and beer, scraping the bottom of the pot to loosen any browned bits.
Step 5: Add the chipotle chile, rinsed beans, and diced tomatoes to the mixture; simmer for 40 minutes or until the chili thickens.
Step 6: Stir in the kosher salt to taste.
Step 7: Serve the chili hot, sprinkling each serving with shredded cheese.

recipes.name: Roasted Vegetables with Nutritional Yeast
ingredients: 2 small heads of broccoli, cut into florets with some stalk attached
1 medium acorn squash, seeds removed and cut into 1/2-inch slices
2 tablespoons virgin coconut oil, warmed to liquefy if necessary
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
Step 2: In a large mixing bowl, toss the broccoli and acorn squash with the warmed coconut oil until evenly coated. Season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Step 3: Spread the vegetables in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet.
Step 4: Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven until they are deep golden brown and tender, approximately 20 to 25 minutes.
Step 5: Remove the vegetables from the oven and let them cool slightly.
Step 6: Once cooled, toss the roasted vegetables with nutritional yeast until evenly coated.
Step 7: Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

recipes.name: Shredded Vegetable Miso Soup
ingredients: 2 teaspoons toasted sesame oil, plus a drizzle for serving
1 large handful of kale, roughly chopped
directions: Step 1: Heat 2 teaspoons of toasted sesame oil in a large pan over medium heat.

Step 2: Add the shredded ginger, sliced garlic, finely sliced leek, shredded carrot, sesame seeds, and half of the shredded red chili to the pan. Cook gently for 10-15 minutes, stirring regularly, until the vegetables are soft.
Step 3: Stir in the brown miso paste, then add 700ml of just-boiled water. Mix well to dissolve the miso.
Step 4: Add the rinsed quinoa and cook gently for an additional 10-15 minutes or until the quinoa is tender.
Step 5: Add the chopped kale to the pan and cook for a few minutes until it is just wilted.
Step 6: Ladle the soup into bowls and top with the remaining shredded red chili and an additional drizzle of sesame oil.

recipes.name: Herb-Seasoned Slow Roast Chicken with Vegetables
ingredients: 4 tablespoons finely chopped fresh woody herbs (such as rosemary, thyme, and oregano)
2 teaspoons flaky sea salt, plus extra for seasoning
4 tablespoons olive oil, plus additional for drizzling
4 medium carrots, scrubbed and chopped into 3-5 cm chunks
2 medium sweet potatoes, scrubbed and chopped into 3-5 cm chunks
2 medium regular potatoes, scrubbed and chopped into 3-5 cm chunks
1 onion, peeled and cut into 8 wedges
1 head of garlic, cloves separated and unpeeled
1 whole chicken (1.5 kg), rinsed and patted dry
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 150°C (300°F).
Step 2: In a small bowl, combine the chopped herbs, 2 teaspoons of flaky sea salt, ground black pepper (if using), and 4 tablespoons of olive oil. Mix well and set aside.

Step 3: Prepare the vegetables by washing and scrubbing the carrots, sweet potatoes, and regular potatoes, leaving their skins on. Chop the vegetables into evenly sized chunks, approximately 3-5 cm each. Place the chopped vegetables into a large roasting pan along with the onion wedges and unpeeled garlic cloves, reserving 2-3 cloves for later. Toss the vegetables with 2 tablespoons of the herb-oil mixture, an additional 2-3 tablespoons of olive oil, and a generous sprinkling of extra salt. Spread the vegetables out in a single layer in the pan.

Step 4: Place the whole chicken on top of the vegetables in the roasting pan. Pour the remaining herb-oil mixture over the chicken, ensuring to rub it thoroughly over the outside and inside of the chicken. Tuck the wing tips behind the chicken and position it breast side up in the center of the pan.

Step 5: Stuff 2 of the lemon quarters inside the chicken's cavity along with the reserved garlic cloves. Use kitchen twine to tie the chicken legs together just above the drumsticks. Place the remaining lemon quarters in the pan with the vegetables.

Step 6: Roast in the preheated oven for 3 to 3.5 hours, rotating the pan halfway through the cooking time. The chicken should be golden brown and the vegetables should be tender with browned edges. When rotating the pan, squeeze the juice from the 2 lemon quarters over the vegetables using tongs, then discard the lemon quarters. Toss the vegetables briefly before returning the pan to the oven.
Step 7: Allow the chicken to rest for 10 minutes before carving. Serve the chicken alongside the roasted vegetables and drizzle with the delicious pan juices.

recipes.name: Air Fryer Harissa Sausage and Vegetable Traybake
ingredients: 2 to 3 tablespoons harissa paste, to taste
100 grams dark green leaves (e.g., kale or cavolo nero), roughly sliced
directions: 1. Preheat the air fryer to 200°C (390°F).
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the chopped butternut squash with 1 tablespoon of rapeseed oil, and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to the air fryer basket and cook for 10 minutes.

3. Drizzle the remaining 0.5 tablespoon of rapeseed oil into the bowl used for the squash. Add the chopped red bell pepper, red onion wedges, and lightly bashed garlic cloves. Toss to coat, then transfer to the air fryer basket and cook for an additional 15 minutes.

4. In the same mixing bowl, combine the sausages, harissa paste, and lemon juice. Mix well and add it to the air fryer basket with the cooked vegetables. Toss everything together and cook for another 15 minutes.
5. After 15 minutes, fold in the dark green leaves and cook for an additional 5 minutes until the leaves are wilted.
6. Serve immediately, optionally garnished with natural yogurt.

Use natural light to enhance the vivid colors, casting soft shadows. Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs and a drizzle of yogurt, while a lemon wedge adds a pop of freshness. recipes.name: Carrot and Green Peas Paratha
ingredients: 1/2 cup green peas, fresh or thawed if frozen
1/4 cup whole wheat flour, for rolling
Extra oil, for cooking the parathas
directions: Step 1: Prepare the carrots by washing, grating, and chopping them finely. If using frozen peas, soak them in hot water for a short time and drain.

Step 2: Heat vegetable oil in a non-stick pan. Once hot, add the mustard seeds and let them splutter. Then, add the cumin seeds, curry leaves, urad dal, and chana dal. Fry for a few minutes until the dals turn light brown.
Step 3: Add the chopped onions, ginger-garlic paste, chopped green chilies, and salt. Sauté until the onions become translucent and aromatic.
Step 4: Stir in the chopped tomatoes and cook the mixture until the tomatoes soften, about 2-3 minutes.

Step 5: Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix well, then add the grated carrots and green peas. Stir the mixture for a few minutes, adding a splash of water if needed, and allow it to cook on low heat for 5 minutes.
Step 6: Once cooked, remove the mixture from heat and stir in the chopped coriander leaves. Set aside to cool.

Step 7: In a mixing bowl, combine the cooled vegetable mixture with the whole wheat flour and a pinch of salt. Mix until well combined. The moisture from the vegetables should suffice, but add a tiny amount of water if necessary to form a soft dough.
Step 8: Cover the dough and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Step 9: Divide the rested dough into small balls, about the size of a golf ball.
Step 10: Roll each ball into a flat disc about 6 inches in diameter using whole wheat flour to prevent sticking.
Step 11: Heat a tava (flat skillet) over medium heat. Place the rolled paratha on the hot tava. Cook until brown spots appear on the bottom side, then flip it over.
Step 12: Apply a little oil on the surface and cook until both sides are golden brown, ensuring even cooking.
Step 13: Repeat the rolling and cooking process for the remaining dough balls. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Thai Red Curry - Quick Weeknight Recipe Ready in 30 Minutes
ingredients: 5-6 fresh red chili peppers, deseeded and chopped
1 piece (about 2 inches) of galangal, peeled and sliced (or substitute with ginger)
2 cups coconut milk, fresh or reconstituted using 8 tablespoons coconut milk powder in 2 cups water
2 cups assorted vegetables (e.g., broccoli, mushrooms, zucchini, colored bell peppers), cut into bite-sized pieces
200 grams firm tofu, cut into cubes
directions: Step 1: Combine the shallots, red chili peppers, garlic, galangal, coriander leaves, ground coriander, and lemongrass in a mortar and pestle or coffee grinder. Grind until you achieve a smooth paste.
Step 2: Reconstitute the coconut milk by mixing 8 tablespoons of coconut milk powder with 2 cups of warm water, stirring until smooth.
Step 3: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the red curry paste and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring continuously until fragrant.
Step 4: Pour in the reconstituted coconut milk, bring the mixture to a gentle simmer, and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Step 5: Add the assorted vegetables and soy sauce to the pan. Stir to combine and cook covered, allowing the vegetables to retain their crunch, approximately 5-10 minutes.
Step 6: Serve hot over steamed rice or jasmine rice.

Style the scene with bamboo chopsticks and a textured linen napkin beside the bowl.
